modal-import-products.title: Import Product catalog
modal-import-products.description: When you import a product catalog, a zero inventory is automatically created for all your locations if a product does not already exist. If the product does exists, it will be updated. Any new product groups specified will also be created automatically.
modal-import-products.import-criteria: Your import file must meet certain criteria before it can be uploaded. Please refer to the example file to see the structure.
modal-import-products.unsure-look-faq: If you are still unsure about the format of the file, please look at our FAQ on
modal-import-products.faq-link: How do I format my import file to the product catalog?
modal-import-products.file-import-example: See how the file should be structured
modal-import-products.drag-and-drop: Drag and drop the file here
modal-import-products.drag-and-drop2: Drag and drop the file here, or click to select
modal-import-products.import-completed-description: Import of your product catalog is now completed.

faq-page.question-user-roles: What can the users roles do?
faq-page.user-roles-description: The user roles are divided into five levels, each with different permissions. They are distributed as follows:
faq-page.role-admin-description: is the highest user role on a customer account and has access to all features, data related to inventory, and user management.
faq-page.role-moderator-description: is the second-highest user role, with the same permissions as an administrator but only at assigned locations.
faq-page.role-user-description: is the regular day-to-day user with access to inventory management functions. This role can be further limited by platform access and whether prices may be displayed.
faq-page.role-departure-description: is for limited inventory management on the warehouse floor, where users only need access to the app to process departures.
faq-page.role-readonly-description: is for very limited access to only viewing the overview and history. This role is limited to the web platform.
faq-page.question-format-import: How do I format my import file to the product catalog?
faq-page.title: Frequently asked questions
faq-page.description: Here you can find answers to the most common asked questions about Nem Lager
faq-page.to-import: To be able to import a file to update your product catalog, the file must meet these criteria.
faq-page.table-data: The table data must be structured in no particular order and contain values that match the list below.
faq-page.product-no-criteria: can contain both numbers and letters
faq-page.barcode-criteria: can contain both numbers and letters
faq-page.product-group-criteria: can contain both numbers and letters
faq-page.unit-criteria: must be written as they appear on the product cards. Case sensitivity is not taken into account. E.g., Stk or stk.
faq-page.text1-criteria: must not contain only numbers. E.g., 34567 must have at least one letter.
faq-page.text2-criteria: must not contain only numbers. E.g., 34567 must have at least one letter. Is optional.
faq-page.text3-criteria: must not contain only numbers. E.g., 34567 must have at least one letter. Is optional.
faq-page.cost-price-criteria: must be separated with a comma (,) for decimals. A thousand separator can be used with a period (.) but is not required.
faq-page.sales-price-criteria: must be separated with a comma (,) for decimals. A thousand separator can be used with a period (.) but is not required.
faq-page.barred-criteria: must be written as either true, false, yes, or no. Truthy values are true and yes. Falsy values are false and no.
